Subject: We only stayed one night in Princeville as one family member woke up with a bunch of bed bugs on her
Description:
SENTENCE: 
We only stayed one night in Princeville as one family member woke up with a bunch of bed bugs on her
TITLE: 
quick response by management
REVIEW: 
We only stayed one night in Princeville as one family member woke up with a bunch of bed bugs on her and many were found on the bedding in the morning. We were quickly accommodated with an alternate accommodation that morning. We were fortunate to be upgraded to a lovely home. We made sure to wash all belongings before entering the new location and no further bed bugs or bites were seen.
Brand: VRBO

Subject: We had bed bugs
Description:
SENTENCE: 
We had bed bugs
TITLE: 
bed bugs
REVIEW: 
We had bed bugs and you put us out on the street
Brand: VRBO

Subject: This house was damaged by hurricane Ian so we canceled our trip in time due to that.
Description:
SENTENCE: 
This house was damaged by hurricane Ian so we canceled our trip in time due to that.
TITLE: 
ridiculous experience
REVIEW: 
This house was damaged by hurricane Ian so we canceled our trip in time due to that. VRBO did NOTHING to assist us in getting our refund and to this date, VRBO has not returned their outrageous fee. We have used VRBO many times but we will never again based on this non-existent customer service.
Brand: VRBO

Subject: We booked this condo before hurricane Ian caused so much damage to the Gulf Coast.
Description:
SENTENCE: 
We booked this condo before hurricane Ian caused so much damage to the Gulf Coast.
TITLE: 
million dollar view
REVIEW: 
We booked this condo before hurricane Ian caused so much damage to the Gulf Coast. Anne Marie was fantastic in communicating the condition and repairs on and around the condo area and because of her we kept our reservation. This condo has so many things going for it. The furnishings are all perfect - clean and in great shape - no wear or stains. The mattress is amazingly comfortable and the sheets are quality! The dishwasher is by far the quietest that we have ever encountered in a rental. The screened in deck showcased fantastic sunrises and had the advantage of shade in the late afternoon. The kitchen was well appointed with nice cookware, dishes and a nice variety of basic spices and coffee. There is not a washer/dryer in the unit but it is a short distance from the condo to the coin machines on the very same floor and detergent is furnished for a load or two. The rainfall shower is wonderful and spacious and there were plenty of amenities for soap/shampoo/conditioners and plenty of clean towels. We did not go to the beach, but there is a great supply of beach items if you choose to go. We did run into a bit of updating that had been delayed due to the hurricane, but it was nothing that the owners had control of and they were so very helpful as we worked our way though that. We had a wonderful and warm week - thank you!
Brand: VRBO

Subject: Ultimately do you safety concerns, we had to evacuate the property the next morning, cutting short our week long stay by 5 nights and having to find a hotel at the last minute.
Description:
SENTENCE: 
Ultimately do you safety concerns, we had to evacuate the property the next morning, cutting short our week long stay by 5 nights and having to find a hotel at the last minute.
TITLE: 
sewage smell on property overwhelmed the beautiful location
REVIEW: 
Pat's at Punaluu is located on a beautiful stretch of beach, perfect for snorkeling. Unfortunately the ongoing construction, which we were told ahead of our stay would be only a minor disturbance. In fact we found out that the sewage treatment is under repair. When we pulled up to the property for our stay a sewage truck was blocking the parking lot, emptying the sewer lines for the building. The second night, in the middle of the night the stench of sewer gas was so strong in our room that our eyes were watering and our infant began coughing. We had to move onto the sofa near the balcony to sleep. Ultimately do you safety concerns, we had to evacuate the property the next morning, cutting short our week long stay by 5 nights and having to find a hotel at the last minute. We called the property manager to inquire about the overpowering sewer gas smell, and he readily acknowledged that the sewage treatment on the property was broken and was an ongoing issue. We believe that the property should not be rented out to other unsuspecting families until the construction of the sewage handling is completed.
Brand: VRBO

Subject: Needed a place to stay while we turned into our property that was damaged due to hurricane Ian.
Description:
SENTENCE: 
Needed a place to stay while we turned into our property that was damaged due to hurricane Ian.
TITLE: 
hurricane ian
REVIEW: 
Needed a place to stay while we turned into our property that was damaged due to hurricane Ian. The property was perfect for our needs and close to siesta key beach, which was a beautiful relief from our hurricane damage home to allow us some downtime and relief. The property was impeccably maintained, and had all the features we needed for a comfortable stay. Highly recommend!
Brand: VRBO

Subject: Hurricane damage washed out the condo's direct access to the water (and the pool is out of order too, not a problem in January) but the beach is accessible via a staircase just a five minute walk away (on 10th).
Description:
SENTENCE: 
Hurricane damage washed out the condo's direct access to the water (and the pool is out of order too, not a problem in January) but the beach is accessible via a staircase just a five minute walk away (on 10th).
TITLE: 
lovely stay on the beach
REVIEW: 
We (a family group of 5) had a wonderful time at this beachfront condo in New Smyrna Beach. The sounds of the waves, long walks on the beach, and cool breezes were a perfect break between two theme park visits. The interior is just as the photos depict and the kitchen is well-stocked with tea & coffee and the leftovers from previous visitors (don't buy olive oil -- there are at least 3 bottles). 

Hurricane damage washed out the condo's direct access to the water (and the pool is out of order too, not a problem in January) but the beach is accessible via a staircase just a five minute walk away (on 10th).

The host (Beverly Trent) was very responsive to all my questions (first time VRBO). I highly recommend the condo and, if I lived in the region, would stay again.
Brand: VRBO

Subject: During the next 5 days, I was briefly stuck on the small elevator that goes to the upper private parking level.
Description:
SENTENCE: 
During the next 5 days, I was briefly stuck on the small elevator that goes to the upper private parking level.
TITLE: 
mixed review
REVIEW: 
I appreciate reviews, take them into consideration, and therefore feel I should also provide them for others. This one is a toughie. So much good, so much annoying. 
We arrived on Sat afternoon and were told that the Wifi was not working, and that the provider was coming later in the day to repair it and were asked would we be there. We would not.
So we kept our plans and when we got to our place later that afternoon there was no Wifi, no repairman, and in fact no tv service. We called our property manager who said the repairman might come Sun or Mon or Tues but she‚Äôd come over to fix the tv. She came, couldn‚Äôt fix it. We were provided a ‚Äúhot spot‚Äù for intermediate, slow internet. While she was there, we showed her kitchen lights that were blinking; she said they were old.
So Sat, Sun, Mon, Tues ‚Äì no tv and no internet except for the hot spot which quit working by Tues. There were some ballgames during these dates that we really wanted to see and prop mgr arranged for us to walk two doors down and watch the tv in that property. I thanked her.
On Tues, we were asked if we‚Äôd be onsite since the repairman was coming for sure. We agreed to stay put. He did come after more calls, complaining about lack of instruction on how to access the property, but at least we were back in business.
On Wed, the tv got so hot, I turned it off and unplugged it, called prop mgr again who said the tv needed replacing and she would get it done soon. I thanked her.
On Thurs, I followed up, she said she had messaged the owner and expected to hear something right away. I thanked her.
On Sat, I followed up again, she said she had messaged the owner and expected to hear something right away. I said, this is exactly what you told me two days ago. And then I elaborated, reminding her that I had paid over $6000 for 13 nights, spent a fair amount of time dealing with stuff that doesn‚Äôt work, including a tv that had worked for 1 day out of the 8 we had been there so far.
A couple of hours later, she and another gal showed up with a new tv. They did not know how to hook it up and called a third gal from the office who came over when she could get away. She got the new tv working. I did not ask for any refund but I did ask the manager during that time if THEY offered any rebates to partially compensate for a trip as full of annoyances as this one. I just made the point that I had spent over $6000 to fly to Marco to rest and the 8 days had been anything but restful. She replied that none of this was anyone‚Äôs fault and she‚Äôd have to ask the owner about any rebate. I said thank you, please do that. As she left my unit, I reiterated, please let me know what the owner says and she said she would. I never heard another word from her.
She did also tell me that they couldn‚Äôt haul the old tv off and she would leave it and the box trash on our front porch for someone to come get. When we left 5 days later, all that trash was still setting there.

During the next 5 days, I was briefly stuck on the small elevator that goes to the upper private parking level. No call button on that elevator worked. We parked our car on the lower level and used the main elevator or the stairs. On the last day, packing to leave, we had suitcases and boxes and bags to ferry from the 4th floor to the first floor parking garage. This time my friend got stuck on the main elevator which then quit working completely. He escaped and called the Esplanade management company number posted on the elevator. That guy sounded unconcerned, yeah, we‚Äôve been having some elevator trouble, I‚Äôll call Otis again, blah, blah, blah. Don‚Äôt you think you should put a sign on the elevator so people will know, we asked. Oh, I‚Äôll just cut off the circuit breaker when I get a chance to get over there, he said. (Sure hope no one was on it.) And we‚Äôre not kids but we could climb up and down 8 flights of stairs; everyone may not be able to do that.

Summary: Did we enjoy our visit? Yes of course because we don‚Äôt let stuff steal our joy and I do think our unit property folks tried at times and I also know stuff happens. But I‚Äôve stayed at Esplanade twice before in two different units in the past few years. I loved the first two visits and can recall only experiencing one issue which was resolved satisfactorily in 10 minutes. The property is still beautiful, the restaurants are great, and the view is just stunning.
But I spent way too much money and time this trip to be wrangling problems I can face at home for free.
Brand: VRBO

Subject: It happened three separate times to the point we stopped using the elevator for fear it would trap us in.
Description:
SENTENCE: 
It happened three separate times to the point we stopped using the elevator for fear it would trap us in.
TITLE: 
great spot to stay
REVIEW: 
Listing was very accurate to the apartment reserved for our weekend trip. The apartment was great for two people. Any more then two-three people and you will feel crowed. The apartment was clean but we did find vomit in the hallway right outside out door.

Check in process was a bit confusing at first, lucky I travel for work a lot and was able to figure out the elevator/door codes and where to go. The parking garage was confusing at first but were able to figure that all out. It was very difficult to exit the garage at night due to the valet from a restaurant blocking most the exit. 

But that elevator.. We would enter the code and would start moving to our floor then the door would not open and would send us back down to whichever floor had just hit the elevator button. It happened three separate times to the point we stopped using the elevator for fear it would trap us in. 

I have been to Nashville for many weekend trips and will keep this location in mind for the next trip.
Brand: VRBO

Bonjour,
Appartement qui aurait besoin d'un bon rafraichissement. Prises √©lectriques au mur qui sortent (juste pos√©es contre le mur) tr√®s DANGEREUX pour les enfants. Manquait un four √† raclette, bols, etc. Beaucoup de perdition de chaleur par les fen√™tres de la salle de bain.

Subject: 130 arrival and hit the Baths... then head to Little Dix Bay around 430 (Rosewood Resort) and rinse off in their outdoor beach shower, change into a sundress and polo with light slacks and loafers (no sandals allowed!)
Description:
SENTENCE: 
130 arrival and hit the Baths... then head to Little Dix Bay around 430 (Rosewood Resort) and rinse off in their outdoor beach shower, change into a sundress and polo with light slacks and loafers (no sandals allowed!)
TITLE: 
relaxing stay on brewers bay
REVIEW: 
Brewers Bay Beach House is a perfect location for those looking for peace and quiet in a Caribbean Tropical setting. Nestled right on a secluded beach, you may not see another human being during your stay... which is exactly what the doctor ordered for those like us wishing to escape the hustle and bustle of city/suburban life for a little R&R. 

Brewers Bay is one of the least crowded bays on Tortola, and it is beautiful. As the pictures show accurately, it is right on the water... lots of toys and a nice reef to snorkel, right in front of the house. 

Things to do... 
- we rented a Suzuki Jimney - you WILL need this to access the property as the roads are sketch... we picked it up right at the ferry dock upon our arrival (Island Time Car Rentals)
- drive to the West End Ferry Dock and catch a 15 min ferry to Jost Van Dyke for 4 hours... rent a Jimney there and take the "road less travelled" over the top of the mountains (NOT FOR THE FAINT OF HEART!)... see the "bubbly pool" (don't forget your bathing suit)... on Beautiful White Bay take 5 mins to get a Painkiller at the Soggy Dollar (where it was invented) and then leave immediately and go next door to eat at Hendos (a much nicer establishment with better food)
- We ate at all the best restaurants on the Island... Best of the Best: Marche at Trellis on Beef Island - incredible Poke Bowl and Sushi Rolls! Sugar Mill Hotel - setting to die for. Dragon Fly Lounge for Lunch. French Deli for coffee / pastries / wine / rum / baguette sandwiches. Brandywine Estate - what a view!
- Drive to Beef Island and take the 20 min ferry ride one day to Virgin Gorda and the Baths... suggest eating at Marche at Trellis at 1130 - right by the ferry dock - take the 100pm to Virgin Gorda... $99 car deal gets you 2 round trip ferry tickets and a rental car for the day... 130 arrival and hit the Baths... then head to Little Dix Bay around 430 (Rosewood Resort) and rinse off in their outdoor beach shower, change into a sundress and polo with light slacks and loafers (no sandals allowed!) have a drink at the RUM Bar, and dine at 6PM at the Reef Restaurant at the resort... then take the 8PM (5 mins away) ferry back to Tortola. Little Dix Bay resort is amazing and worth a visit - grab a bike at the visitor's parking lot!
- Rent a boat (with or without a skipper) at Island Time an take the 20 min ride to The Indians for the best snorkeling in the VBI

A wonderful VACAY in a magical place!
Brand: VRBO

Subject: First the hot tub had WAY too much chlorine, to the point we both ended up with chlorine rashes.
Description:
SENTENCE: 
First the hot tub had WAY too much chlorine, to the point we both ended up with chlorine rashes.
TITLE: 
overall nice cabin.
REVIEW: 
Had an amazing time with just a couple issues. First the hot tub had WAY too much chlorine, to the point we both ended up with chlorine rashes. Second was the grill ran out of propane while cooking second night. Gated community was extremely nice and we would stay again.
Brand: VRBO
